## Overview



### Uses
Titrating pH, destruction of RNAse on glass slides

## Components
1. $diH_2O$
2. 37% $HCl$ (Sigma-Aldrich)
3. Sterile container


## Protocol: Preparation of 500mL 1M (1N) HCl

1. In a vented hood, add $200\ mL$ of $diH_2O$ to a beaker with a stir bar
2. Add $41.05\ mL$ of $37\%\ HCl$ to the beaker
3. Dilute to a total of $500\ mL$ with $diH_2O$ 
4. Transfer into a glass container that seals adequately

### Calculation

$$
\frac{37\ g\ HCl}{100\ mL} x \frac{1.2\ g}{mL} x \frac{1\ mol\ HCl}{36.46\ g} x \frac{1000\ mL}{1 \ L} = 12.18\ M\ HCl
$$

$$
(12.18\ M\ HCl)(500\ mL) = (1\ M\ HCl)(41.05\ mL)
$$

## Storage
- Store in an appropriate corrosive reagent storage
